body.p: This element is used to provide a label for a control element. If the user clicks the label, it will move the focus to the associated control, specified with the template.PrefAnch("a-", "control") attribute.
More information is available in the XUL tutorial.

body.p: The following classes may be used to style the element. These classes should be used instead of changing the style of the element directly since they will fit more naturally with the user's selected theme.

div.p: Starting inÂ Gecko 2.0 geckoRelease("2.0"), labels are properly not focusable. They used to incorrectly inherit from interface("nsIDOMXULControlElement").

body.h4: The caption is in the "value" attribute
body.p: Remember that the label element has a "value" attribute, unlike value in HTML whereas buttons, checkboxes use label="foo" as the attribute
body.pre:
<label label="A Caption"/> <-- wrong --> <label value="A Caption"/>
<label value="Click the button"/> <button label="A Button"/> <checkbox label="A Decision" value="1"/>
